definition: 100 ml/one-tenth of a peck/measure for dry grain equal to one-tenth of sheng 升 or liter, or one-hundredth dou 斗
to close/to join/to fit/to be equal to/whole/together/round (in battle)/conjunction (astronomy)/1st note of pentatonic scale/old variant of 盒[he2]
on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)

sentences.english: And when we buried him beneath the willow.
sentences.chinese: 当我们将他下葬合上了柳木棺盖。

sentences.english: You are directed to step inside the elevator and the doors close.
sentences.chinese: 他们引着你步入这部电梯，电梯门合上了。

sentences.english: The lid shut with a snap.
He squeezed his nose, closed his mouth, and blew really hard.
sentences.chinese: 他挤挤鼻子，合上嘴，并且使劲儿吹。

sentences.english: A book , tight shut, is but a block of paper.
sentences.chinese: 书，如果被紧紧合上而不看，那将只是一叠纸。

sentences.english: She had not even dared to close her eyes for fear it would be morning when she opened them again.
sentences.chinese: 她甚至不敢合上眼，担朽旎闭一睁就已是早起了。

sentences.english: A book, tight shut, is but a block of paper.
sentences.chinese: 一本书，如果紧紧合上不读，只是一叠废纸。

sentences.english: Now please close your little finger then try to open your ring fingers.
sentences.chinese: 那么，请大家合上小母指，再试着张开无名指。

sentences.english: They file on, they file off.
sentences.chinese: 他们打开档案，又合上档案。

sentences.english: LJ looks at the man who murdered his family, then closes the phone.
sentences.chinese: LJ看着这个谋杀了他全家的人，合上了手机。

sentences.english: The play, the end is not the outcome closed.
sentences.chinese: 那场戏，终是没有结局的合上了。

sentences.english: He had not wanted to smudge the creamy paper by shutting the book while the ink was wet.
sentences.chinese: 他不愿在墨迹未干之前就合上本子弄污乳白的纸张。

sentences.english: The coffin closed with a dull thud.
sentences.chinese: 棺材合上时发出一声闷响。

sentences.english: Morning-glories upfold their flowers by noon.
sentences.chinese: 牵牛花在中午时就合上了。

definition: to close (a door)/to turn off (light, electrical equipment etc)
to close (flower, eyes, suitcase etc)/to bring together/(insect or bird when not flying) to fold (its wings)
to close/to stop up/to shut/to obstruct
to move (sth) aside/to step aside/to move over (when sitting on a bench)/to shift (one's gaze)
